abstract: After Carl Icahn extended his $5.50 a share bid for Dynegy, Seneca Capital, the energy company’s second largest shareholder, said it would reject a $6 a share offer for the energy company — should such a bid materialize.
snippet: After Carl Icahn extended his $5.50 a share bid for Dynegy, Seneca Capital, the energy company’s second largest shareholder, said it would reject a $6 a share offer for the energy company — should such a bid materialize.
lead_paragraph: Seneca Capital, the second-largest shareholder of Dynegy, said on Wednesday that it would reject a $6 a share offer for the energy company — should such a bid materialize.

headline.main: Seneca Pre-Emptively Rejects Dynegy Offer at $6 a Share
